question: 慰める
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>consolation</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to console</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: I'm going <vocabulary>to console</vocabulary> you for what happened to you. The <reading>nag saw</reading> (<ja>なぐさ</ja>) was turned on and buzzed through your leg. What a nagging feeling. You need some consoling.
